ARABIC: وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ خُبْرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: How indeed could you bear with patience something you have not encompassed in your knowledge?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: How can you bear that which is beyond your comprehension?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: For how can you patiently bear with something you cannot encompass in your knowledge?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: How can you remain patient with that which you do not fully understand?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And how will you bear something which your knowledge does not encompass?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And how can you have patience about a thing which you know not"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And how can you have patience in that of which you have not got a comprehensive knowledge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And how shouldst thou bear patiently that thou hast never encompassed in thy knowledge?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: How canst thou bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any knowledge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: How could you be patient in matters beyond your knowledge?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And how canst thou have patience over that which thy knowledge encompasseth not
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And how can you have patience about something you do not comprehend?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy understanding is not complete?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And how can you have patience about a thing which you know not?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: For how can you bear patiently with that which you have never encompassed in your knowledge'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And how will you endure what you have no knowledge of?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:68] And how can you bear with that whereof you have never been informed?’: in the above-mentioned hadīth [of Bukhārī] after this verse [there is the following statement]: ‘O Moses, I possess knowledge which God has taught me and which you do not have, and [equally] you possess knowledge which God has taught you and which I do not have’. (His saying khubran, ‘informed’, is a verbal noun meaning that which you have never encompassed, in other words, the truth of which you have never been informed of.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: When Moses said he will be able to bear anything, Khidr said: (How canst thou) Moses (bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any knowledge) that the explanation of which you have not been given?
